metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26934 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: phpMyAdmin before 4.9.6 and 5.x before 5.0.3 allows XSS through the transformation feature via a crafted link. It was discovered that phpMyAdmin was vulnerable to an XSS attack. If a victim were to click on a crafted link, an attacker could run malicious JavaScript on the victim's system.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> vulerability was introduced in 2.5.0. File where issue is is different in bionic and earlier. litios> intrusive patch for xenial and earlier as the signing funcionality is not present.

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
